==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|s=乌}}

===Glyph origin===
{{liushu|p}} – a bird. Compare {{zh-l|*鳥|bird}}, of similar development.

Sense “black, dark” generalized from crow – “black as a crow”. Compare {{och-l|黑|black as ink}}.

===Etymology===
“Crow”: Onomatopoeic (*''qaː''). Cognate with {{och-l|鴉|crow; raven}}, which retains the earlier vowel in Middle Chinese (*''ʔˠa'').

Interrogative pronoun: Related to the following interrogative pronouns with similar phonological shapes in Old Chinese ({{zh-ref|Wang, 1982}}), with differing suffixes:
* {{och-l|焉}}
* {{och-l|惡}}
* {{och-l|安}}
